remarks: In an ordered monoid, the ordering is compatible with group power. This version does not require the monoid to be commutative. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Mar-2018.)
statement:
omndmul.0 $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
omndmul.1 $e |- .<_ = ( le ` M ) $.
omndmul3.m $e |- .x. = ( .g ` M ) $.
omndmul3.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` M ) $.
omndmul3.o $e |- ( ph -> M e. oMnd ) $.
omndmul3.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
omndmul3.2 $e |- ( ph -> P e. NN0 ) $.
omndmul3.3 $e |- ( ph -> N <_ P ) $.
omndmul3.4 $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
omndmul3.5 $e |- ( ph -> .0. .<_ X ) $.
omndmul3 $p |- ( ph -> ( N .x. X ) .<_ ( P .x. X ) ) $.
